Metadata: Red tides: west coast newsletter on marine biotoxins and harmful algal blooms

This edition of the Red Tides newsletter addresses the problem of harmful algal blooms (HABs) on the West Coast The cost of HABs is highlighted in this issue, including economic impacts on human health, coastal fisheries, and environmental quality. Brief articles also describe the impact of HABs on oysters, Dungeness crab, razor clams, and the people who depend on healthy shellfish for subsistence harvests. Reports of current research are also included.
